intro: Stephanothelys sororia, commonly known as the dwarf stephanotis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that resemble those of the stephanotis genus. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
